tp.pr4.logic

Class Game

  • java.lang.Object
    • tp.pr4.logic.Game
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Observable<GameObserver>

    public class Game
extends java.lang.Object
implements Observable<GameObserver>
    Class which contains the Game information. It stores the state of the board, whose turn it is, whether or not one of the players has won, etc. as well as the list of moves that have been made in order to undo them if required. The game saves at least the last 10 moves.
    Since:
    Assignment 1.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Game

        public Game(GameRules rules)
        Constructs a new game.
        Since:
        Assignment 2
        Parameters:
        rules - The game rules that are to be used during this game (at least until a reset is performed).

    • Method Detail

      • reset

        public void reset(GameRules rules)
        Restarts the current game. This operation cannot be undone. The parameter enables the type of game to be changed on reset.
        Since:
        Assignment 2
        Parameters:
        rules - The game rules that are to be used from now on.

      • executeMove

        public void executeMove(Move move)
                 throws InvalidMove
        Executes the move indicated.
        Since:
        Assignment 2
        Parameters:
        move - Move to be executed. It is assumed that the move is compatible with the rules of the game being played (if Connect-4 is being played, the move is a Connect-4 move etc.) If this is not the case, the behaviour is undefined.
        Throws:
        InvalidMove - if the move can't be carried out. It is an error for a player to try and place a counter out of turn, or when the game has finished,...

      • undo

        public boolean undo()
        Undo the last move executed.
        Returns:
        true if the undo was succesfully performed.

      • getTurn

        public Counter getTurn()
        Returns the colour of the player whose turn it is to move.
        Returns:
        Colour of the player, or Counter.EMPTY if the game has finished.

      • getWinner

        public Counter getWinner()
        Returns the colour of the winner. It is only valid if the game has finished (finished==true).
        Returns:
        Colour of the winner. If the game finished in a draw, Counter.EMPTY. If the game has not yet finished the result is undefined.

      • isFinished

        public boolean isFinished()
        Returns true if the game has finised and false otherwise.
        Returns:
        true if the game has finished.

      • getBoard

        public Board getBoard()
        Accessor method for the board. This method is added for the convenience of the unit tester but should not be used.
        Returns:
        Current state of the board.
